After brief orientation by the chairman, questions from the floor were invitee:
Question: How is the appeal in Pittsburgh coming after 2 years?
Daniel: Not very well. After we went on the air, it’s been hard to get sub¬
scriptions due to our administrative arrangements, so a good many gimmicks have
been used.
Wheatley: In Boston, the Citizen’s Committee raised dollars, but these are not
actually community service funds as such. We make use of grants of aid from
businesses to finance particular series of programs. Experimentally this may be
done for other series as well. However, all dollars for construction are private
funds.
Question: Dollars from an institution?
Wheatley: Not directly, but there are some contributions in either dollars
or manpower for assistance. It doesn’t bear up strictly as institutional under
analysis.
Question: After the initial investment, what do you estimate will be the run¬
ning expenses for Channel 2?
Gunn: At first, it will be about $300,000 for radio and TV, and then, we don’t
know.
Question: What will be your telecasting schedule?
Gunn: It will be an eight hour day, five days a week. Right now we 11 be
able to do at least a four hour day with possibly more later on. This would use
one crew.
Question: In ETV, there is a great deal of use of students to cut costs. Will
organized labor groups oppose this? Will labor step in?
